title: Calories in 1/2 Cup Blueberries
meta_description: Discover calories in 1/2 cup blueberries, including carbs, fiber, sugars, protein, and full nutrition breakdown per serving.
assumptions: Fresh, raw blueberries; 1/2 cup â‰ˆ74 g; no added sugar or toppings.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by variety, ripeness, and preparation; fresh vs. frozen may differ slightly. Check labels when available.

quick_answer.text: 1/2 cup blueberries provides ~42 kcal, mostly from carbs with good fiber.

label_note: Totals mirror Nutrition Facts labels for easy comparison.

faqs.q: How many calories in 1/2 cup blueberries?
What are the carbs in 1/2 cup blueberries?
faqs.a: About 10.7 g total carbs, including 1.8 g fiber and 7.4 g sugars.

faqs.q: Are blueberries low in fat and protein?
faqs.a: Yes, only 0.2 g fat and 0.5 g protein per 1/2 cup.

faqs.q: How does frozen affect calories in 1/2 cup blueberries?
faqs.a: Negligible change; frozen retains similar nutrition to fresh.

faqs.q: Why are blueberries good for fiber intake?
faqs.a: They provide 1.8 g fiber per 1/2 cup, aiding digestion and satiety.
